alert.note: Alert for Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 14 at 5:59AM CST until December 15 at 9:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Winter Storm Impacts Today Through Thursday... A wintry mix continues in north-central Wisconsin this morning with multiple rounds of precipitation persisting into Thursday. Icing, especially on elevated surfaces such as bridges, may result in slippery to hazardous driving conditions combined with tree damage from winds gusting near 45 mph. This wintry mix will alleviate midday before another round of snow develops tonight. Several inches of snow are possible Wednesday night in north- central Wisconsin. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Taylor County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 6 PM this evening to 9 AM CST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
